descript.abstract:
This layer contains the rough boundaries of the sewersheds for the Twin Cities metropolitan area. A sewershed is a defined area that is tributary to a single point along an MCES interceptor pipe (a community connection to an interceptor) or is tributary to a single lift station. Community boundaries are also used to define sewer-shed boundaries.
The data are derived from community comprehensive sewer plans.
Notes: - The sewersheds are estimated. The actual sewersheds may be different. - Not all records contain county or MCD information.
descript.purpose: To provide more manageable areas for flow analysis and planning and to distinguish between the sewered and unsewered areas within the Metropolitan Urban Service Area (MUSA).
descript.supplinf: Twin Cities 7 County Metropolitan Area. This includes the counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington in Minnesota.

timeperd.current: Sewershed polygon data is based on most recent local sanitary system available to MCES, and MCES interceptors.

theme.themekey: sewershed, utilities, sewer, sewage, sewerage, waste water

place.placekey: Twin Cities, Anoka County, Carver County, Dakota County, Hennepin County, Ramsey County, Scott County, Washington County

browse.browsed: Sample map showing the Sewersheds layer.

dataqual.complete: Entire seven county geographic area is covered.

horizpa.horizpar: The positional accuracy of the dataset has not been tested under the National Standards for Spatial Data Accuracy. The positional accuracy of the dataset is UNKNOWN.

procstep.procdesc:
The dataset includes information from comprehensive plans submitted as of March 18th, 1997.
The dataset is derived from community comprehensive sewer plans and is referenced to the MnDOT (1992) street base.
The dataset is updated as new comprehensive plans are submitted to the Council.
The sewersheds are estimated. The actual sewersheds may be different.

spdoinfo.mgmg3til: One layer for entire seven county region.

overview.eaover:
Polygon Attributes are:
Unique_ID: Tributary connection point on MCES interceptor (relational to InterceptorPoints)
Local_LS: Populated when shed is tributary to local lift station.
SewerState: 0= will not be served, 1= currently served, 2= potentially served.
CTU_ID: Numeric city identifier.
CTU_NAME: Text city identifier.
ID_NO: Text interceptor identifier to which the shed is tributary.
INTERCEPT: Numeric interceptor identifier to which the shed is tributary.
METER: Meter to which shed is a tributary
WWTP: Treatment plant to which shed is a tributary
SERVED: U = Unmetered, N = Not Served
FLOWS_TO: Community serving an Unmetered shed.
ADJUSTED: Is the Unmetered shed used in-house to adjust billing?
IC_AGREEMENT: Hyperlink address of intercommunity agreement for unmetered flow.
